intro: Atractylodes, commonly known as Chinese ginger or earthnut, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit and aromatic leaves that contain essential oils. The plant is native to Asia and is often found in moist, temperate regions. Atractylodes species are used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties. The flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in composite heads.
